chapter.title: Partisjoner og oppstart
chapter.para: This section contains information about how to change the way that your computer behaves when you first turn it on, and how to access other operating systems and partitions from Ubuntu.

sect1.title: Grafisk partisjons redigering
sect1.para: Gparted er et grafisk verktøy for endring av disk partisjoner.

step.para: Install the gparted package (see ).
You can run the application with &gparted;.

sect1.title: Make Windows partitions available from Ubuntu
sect1.para: Windows partitions should be automatically available from any Ubuntu system. If they are not, you can make them available using the Disks Manager.

step.para: Open &disks;.
Select the correct hard disk, and click Partitions.
Select the relevant partition, and click Enable.
To unmount the partition, click Disable.

sect1.title: Make Windows partitions automatically available
sect1.para: Windows partitions should be automatically available from Ubuntu. If they are not, the following procedure will make them automatically available:

step.para: Read
First make a directory where the partition can be made available ("mounted"):
Next, back up your disk configuration file and open the file in a text editor with administrative privileges:
Append the following line at the end of file: /dev/hda1 /media/windows ntfs umask=0222 0 0

note.para: Replace /dev/hda1 with the correct device name for your partition.
If your Windows partition uses the FAT32 filesystem, replace ntfs with vfat in the above command.
If you have a FAT32 filesystem, it is also safe to allow read-write access. To do this, change the value of umask to 0000.

step.para: Save the edited file (an example).
The changes will take effect when the computer is restarted.

sect2.title: Check disk space usage and view the partition table

step.para: Open &disks;.
Select the Harddrive, then the Partitions tab
Each partition will be listed under Partition List, with disk space and mount point.
